lexUnit.name: snort.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: make a noise by inhaling forcefully through a constricted nasal passage.

sentence.text: She snorted softly and he could imagine her smiling in the darkness .
Then an animal snorted quietly and broke the momentary stillness .
Madame Mattli snorted angrily .
It stamped a foot and snorted briskly .
She controlled the horse with a length of twine and she had authority over the animal , which snorted then stepped proudly round to the gate .
Blazer snorted wildly and reared .
The animal plunged to a halt , snorting and tossing its head nervously as water sprayed into the air around them .
Marcus snorted and woke up .
He took a step backwards ; the horse snorted and shifted restlessly behind him .
Friesian cattle snorted and frothed behind a railing .
Across the garden , the big yellow dog snorted and made digging motions with his paws .
Zhukov snorted in annoyance .
Hayman snorted in disgust .
The man snorted like a ploughhorse getting its breath after turning a long furrow .
Snorting at the friar 's apparent stupidity , Cranston turned his horse and led them out of the main alleyways of Southwark .
Ross snorted with exasperation .
The three little piggies snorted in disgust .
When badgers are alarmed , they snort .
He gave me a sidelong glance and smiled and snorted , which meant I must be out of my tiny mind .

The horse may also snort , which clears the respiratory tract , thereby increasing his smelling ability and also allowing ease of breathing if the object proves to be dangerous and flight is necessary .
